private_information: I can move only the top disk to another peg if the move is legal
left_manager.goal: Participate in moving the entire tower to the right peg following the Tower of Hanoi rules

private_information: I can receive or send the top disk if the move is legal
middle_manager.goal: Participate in moving the entire tower to the right peg following the Tower of Hanoi rules

private_information: I can receive or send the top disk if the move is legal
right_manager.goal: Participate in moving the entire tower to the right peg following the Tower of Hanoi rules

orchestrator.goal: Produce a complete PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards that solves the Tower of Hanoi instance by moving all disks from the left peg to the right peg

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right
There are 5 disks labeled A,B,C,D,E from smallest A to largest E
Rules: move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on top of a smaller one
Initial configuration: left peg top->bottom A,B,C,D,E; middle peg empty; right peg empty
Goal configuration: left peg empty; middle peg empty; right peg top->bottom A,B,C,D,E

report.system_prompt: You are the left peg manager. Report your current peg state and any private constraints or capabilities. Provide a concise machine-readable state string that lists disks top to bottom and note you can move only the top disk and only if the target peg allows it.
report.prompt: As left_manager provide a concise state report that includes the peg name, the ordered list of disks from top to bottom, and any local constraints. Do not produce PDDL. Output should be suitable for an orchestrator to consume.

report.system_prompt: You are the middle peg manager. Report your current peg state and any private constraints or capabilities. Provide a concise machine-readable state string that lists disks top to bottom and note you can move only the top disk and only if the target peg allows it.
report.prompt: As middle_manager provide a concise state report that includes the peg name, the ordered list of disks from top to bottom, and any local constraints. Do not produce PDDL. Output should be suitable for an orchestrator to consume.

report.system_prompt: You are the right peg manager. Report your current peg state and any private constraints or capabilities. Provide a concise machine-readable state string that lists disks top to bottom and note you can move only the top disk and only if the target peg allows it.
report.prompt: As right_manager provide a concise state report that includes the peg name, the ordered list of disks from top to bottom, and any local constraints. Do not produce PDDL. Output should be suitable for an orchestrator to consume.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL and task planning for the FastDownwards planner. You must produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that encode the Tower of Hanoi instance described by the agents' state reports and the public information. Target the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent actions logically distinct if modeling agents explicitly. Ensure the domain encodes legal moves: one disk at a time and no larger disk on a smaller disk. Use disk names A B C D E and peg names left middle right.
pddl.prompt: You will receive three peg state reports from the managers. Integrate those reports with the public information to produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that solve the instance by moving all disks from left to right under Tower of Hanoi rules. If some report is partial, do not invent additional initial facts beyond what is provided; instead explicitly document assumptions in comments and produce the best PDDL consistent with the received reports. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The generated PDDL should be suitable to feed to FastDownwards.
